translation.text: Raag Dayv-Gandhaaree, Fifth Mehl, Seventh House:

melody.description: There is no melody or mood associated with this line, which may be because it is the preamble to the hymn, or is not meant to be read in any particular melody or mood

author.author: None
author.description: There is no author associated with this line, as it may be the preamble to the hymn

translation.text: One Universal Creator God. By The Grace Of The True Guru:

melody.description: There is no melody or mood associated with this line, which may be because it is the preamble to the hymn, or is not meant to be read in any particular melody or mood

author.author: None
author.description: There is no author associated with this line, as it may be the preamble to the hymn

text: ਸਭ ਦਿਨ ਕੇ ਸਮਰਥ ਪੰਥ ਬਿਠੁਲੇ ਹਉ ਬਲਿ ਬਲਿ ਜਾਉ ॥

translation.text: You are all-powerful, at all times; You show me the Way; I am a sacrifice, a sacrifice to You.

transliteration.text: sabh din kē samarath panth bithulē hau bal bal jāu .

melody.description: Devgandhari conveys the feeling of satisfaction that comes from making an achievement. These emotions make the listener feel empowered to do more and diminish any feelings of laziness. This state of satisfaction is that of extreme happiness and contentment, and leaves the listener with the feeling of being in paradise.

author.author: Guru Arjan Dev
author.description:
Guru Arjan Dev [1563 - 1606] was the fifth Guru of the Sikhs, born at Goindval. He was the youngest of the three sons of Guru Ram Das, the fourth Sikh Guru.

Guru Arjan Dev finished the construction of the Harimandir Sahib, the Golden Temple, and compiled the first Sikh scripture, known as the Adi Granth. Shortly after he became the first martyr of the Sikh religion, which formed a turning point in the development of the faith.

text: ਗਾਵਨ ਭਾਵਨ ਸੰਤਨ ਤੋਰੈ ਚਰਨ ਉਵਾ ਕੈ ਪਾਉ ॥੧॥ ਰਹਾਉ ॥

translation.text: Your Saints sing to You with love; I fall at their feet. ||1||Pause||

transliteration.text: gāvan bhāvan santan tōrai charan uvā kai pāu .1. rahāu .

melody.description: Devgandhari conveys the feeling of satisfaction that comes from making an achievement. These emotions make the listener feel empowered to do more and diminish any feelings of laziness. This state of satisfaction is that of extreme happiness and contentment, and leaves the listener with the feeling of being in paradise.

author.author: Guru Arjan Dev
author.description:
Guru Arjan Dev [1563 - 1606] was the fifth Guru of the Sikhs, born at Goindval. He was the youngest of the three sons of Guru Ram Das, the fourth Sikh Guru.

Guru Arjan Dev finished the construction of the Harimandir Sahib, the Golden Temple, and compiled the first Sikh scripture, known as the Adi Granth. Shortly after he became the first martyr of the Sikh religion, which formed a turning point in the development of the faith.

text: ਜਾਸਨ ਬਾਸਨ ਸਹਜ ਕੇਲ ਕਰੁਣਾ ਮੈ ਏਕ ਅਨੰਤ ਅਨੂਪੈ ਠਾਉ ॥੧॥

translation.text: O Praiseworthy Lord, Enjoyer of celestial peace, Embodiment of mercy, One Infinite Lord, Your place is so beautiful. ||1||

transliteration.text: jāsan bāsan sahaj kēl karunā mai ēk anant anūpai thāu .1.

melody.description: Devgandhari conveys the feeling of satisfaction that comes from making an achievement. These emotions make the listener feel empowered to do more and diminish any feelings of laziness. This state of satisfaction is that of extreme happiness and contentment, and leaves the listener with the feeling of being in paradise.

author.author: Guru Arjan Dev
author.description:
Guru Arjan Dev [1563 - 1606] was the fifth Guru of the Sikhs, born at Goindval. He was the youngest of the three sons of Guru Ram Das, the fourth Sikh Guru.

Guru Arjan Dev finished the construction of the Harimandir Sahib, the Golden Temple, and compiled the first Sikh scripture, known as the Adi Granth. Shortly after he became the first martyr of the Sikh religion, which formed a turning point in the development of the faith.

text: ਰਿਧਿ ਸਿਧਿ ਨਿਧਿ ਕਰ ਤਲ ਜਗਜੀਵਨ ਸ੍ਰਬ ਨਾਥ ਅਨੇਕੈ ਨਾਉ ॥

translation.text: Riches, supernatural spiritual powers and wealth are in the palm of Your hand. O Lord, Life of the World, Master of all, infinite is Your Name.

transliteration.text: ridh sidh nidh kar tal jagajīvan srab nāth anēkai nāu .

melody.description: Devgandhari conveys the feeling of satisfaction that comes from making an achievement. These emotions make the listener feel empowered to do more and diminish any feelings of laziness. This state of satisfaction is that of extreme happiness and contentment, and leaves the listener with the feeling of being in paradise.

Guru Arjan Dev finished the construction of the Harimandir Sahib, the Golden Temple, and compiled the first Sikh scripture, known as the Adi Granth. Shortly after he became the first martyr of the Sikh religion, which formed a turning point in the development of the faith.

text: ਦਇਆ ਮਇਆ ਕਿਰਪਾ ਨਾਨਕ ਕਉ ਸੁਨਿ ਸੁਨਿ ਜਸੁ ਜੀਵਾਉ ॥੨॥੧॥੩੮॥੬॥੪੪॥

translation.text: Show Kindness, Mercy and Compassion to Nanak; hearing Your Praises, I live. ||2||1||38||6||44||

transliteration.text: daiā maiā kirapā nānak kau sun sun jas jīvāu .2.1.38.6.44.

These emotions make the listener feel empowered to do more and diminish any feelings of laziness. This state of satisfaction is that of extreme happiness and contentment, and leaves the listener with the feeling of being in paradise.
